metadata.title: CVE-2022-38475 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could have written a value to the first element in azero-length JavaScript array. Although the array was zero-length, the valuewas not written to an invalid memory address. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 104.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38475` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
